description: Conversion of upper ground floor, first floor, second floor, loft level and rear of lower ground floor from Office (Use Class B1a) to Residential (Use Class C3) to accommodate four self-contained flats; associated amenity spaces; single-storey rear extension (following demolition of existing garage and extensions); first and second floor rear and infill extensions involving formation of Juliet balconies; alteration of roof from hip to gable end; roof extension to rear of main roofslope involving formation of a Juliet balcony; installation of three rooflights to front roofslope; formation of recessed balcony at upper ground floor level (following partial demolition of existing rear extension); alterations to front, rear and side fenestrations involving the installation and replacement of windows; and alterations to forecourt to refurbish boundary treatments and provide cycle and waste storage spaces
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (As Amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titles: 20-2018/RA/200 Rev. C; 20-2018/RA/201 Rev. C; 20-2018/RA/202 Rev. C; 203-2018/RA/204 Rev. C; 20-2018/RA/205 Rev. C; 20-2018/RA/206 Rev. C; 20-2018/RA/207 Rev. C -- Proposed Front Elevation; 20-2018/RA/207 Rev. C -- Proposed Side Elevation; 20-2018/RA/208 Rev. C; 20-2018/RA/210; 20-2018/RA/400; and 20-2018/RA/401.

REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match or complement the appearance of those of the existing building and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with the Ealing Common Conservation Area Management Plan (2009) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | A minimum of three (3) 240.0 litre bins dedicated to recycling, three (3) 240.0 litre bins dedicated to refuse, and four (4) 23.0 litre bins dedicated to food waste shall be provided in the forecourt of the property separate from the commercial bin store in accordance with dwg. 20-2018/RA/201 Rev. C of the Approved Plans and the adopted standards of the London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies 5.17 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Commercial refuse and recycling storage facilities shall be provided in a bin store separate from the residential bin store in accordance with dwg. 20-2018/RA/201 Rev. C of the Approved Plans and the adopted standards of the local authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies 5.17 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | A minimum of eight (8) secured cycle parking spaces shall be provided in accordance with dwgs. 20-2018/RA/200 Rev. C and 20-2018/RA/201 Rev. C of the Approved Plans and the adopted standards of the London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | Enhanced sound insulation for the approved dwelling units shall be installed to achieve an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bathroom above bedroom of separate lower ground floor dwelling. The enhanced sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the unit(s) and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and the interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | No part of any roof, other than the recessed roof balcony hereby approved for the upper ground floor level and illustrated in the drawings listed in Condition 2, shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The side-facing windows to be installed at the upper ground, first, and second floor as shown in dwg, 20-2018/RA/207 Rev. C -- Proposed Side Elevation of the Approved Plans must be obscure-glazed and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The three rooflights to be installed on the front of the main roofslope as shown in dwg. 20-2018/RA/207 Rev. C -- Proposed Front Elevation shall be of a conservation-style and so maintained.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with the Ealing Common Conservation Area Management Plan (2009) and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | Prior to commencement of construction and demolition works, a detailed Construction Method Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must detail the:
-	On-site construction worker parking;
-	Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site;
-	Delivery times and booking system (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods);
-	Site access for construction traffic and contractor staff parking and associated signage;
-	Consolidated or re-timed trips;
-	Secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities;
-	Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear;
-	Locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors' offices;

-	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents including the name, telephone number and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These contact details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound; and
-	Use of Transport for London's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of the works.

REASON: To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 6.3 of the London Plan (2016); and 1.1(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012.
